title: Fountain Releases Three New Typefaces
content:
Submitted by [Joe Pemberton](http://web.archive.org/web/20091124180907/http:/typophile.com/user/1160 "View user profile.") : 9.Jul.2003 4.01pm 

The Fountain catalogue has been updated with the 3 new type families:   
   
Alita - a text face placed somewhere between renaissance and transitional Antiqua, designed by Peter Hoffmann. [[http://www.fountain.nu/catalogue/alita.asp](http://web.archive.org/web/20091124180907/http:/www.fountain.nu/catalogue/alita.asp)   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20091124180907im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/72/12734.gif)   
   
Paracelsus - a modern take on the old gothic type form called Schwabach, designed by Lars Bergquist. [[http://www.fountain.nu/catalogue/paracelsus.asp](http://web.archive.org/web/20091124180907/http:/www.fountain.nu/catalogue/paracelsus.asp) ]   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20091124180907im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/72/12735.gif)   
   
Waldstein - a Scotch typeface named after young Beethoven's mecenat, this is also designed by Lars Bergquist. [[http://www.fountain.nu/catalogue/waldstein.asp](http://web.archive.org/web/20091124180907/http:/www.fountain.nu/catalogue/waldstein.asp)   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20091124180907im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/72/12736.gif)   
   
We have added a new section to the site called - "Visual Overview" - where you can take a fast peek on our whole collection of typefaces.   
   
The second release will be next week when we release 2 new fonts by Martin Fredrikson, plus an update of some of his earlier typefaces.   
   
Peter Bruhn, principal designer & owner   
   
 [http://www.fountain.nu/](http://web.archive.org/web/20091124180907/http:/www.fountain.nu/)
author: Joe Pemberton
